meanings.definition: Dod: to evade or avoid something
meanings.sent1: She dods the chores by pretending to be asleep.
meanings.sent2: He always dods his responsibilities at home.
meanings.sent3: The cat dods the bath time by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The student dods the difficult questions during the exam.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel dods the dog by quickly climbing up the tree.

meanings.definition: Dods: plural of dod, used to refer to multiple instances of evading or avoiding something
meanings.sent1: The dods of the mouse were cleverly planned.
meanings.sent2: She collected all the dods of excuses to skip the party.
meanings.sent3: The dods of the children trying to avoid bedtime were amusing.
meanings.sent4: The dods of raindrops on the window created a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The dods of cars on the highway seemed like a never-ending stream.
